ru.myx.ae3.common

Interface BodyAccessUnknown

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BaseMessage, BaseMessageEditable<T>, BinaryMessage<T>, BinaryReplyAnswer<T>, BinaryServeRequest<T>, BodyAccessBinary, BodyAccessCharacter, CharacterMessage<T>, CharacterReplyAnswer<T>, CharacterServeRequest<T>, ReplyAnswer, ReplyAnswerEditable<T>, ServeRequest, ServeRequestEditable<T>, UniversalMessage<T>, UniversalReplyAnswer<T>, UniversalServeRequest<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCharacterServeRequest, AbstractMessage, AbstractMessageMutable, AbstractReplyAnswer, AbstractReplyAnswerMutable, AbstractReplyException, AbstractServeRequest, AbstractServeRequestMutable, AbstractWrapMessage, AbstractWrapMessageWithOwnAttributes, AbstractWrapReplyAnswer, AbstractWrapReplyAnswerWithOwnAttributes, AbstractWrapServeRequest, AbstractWrapServeRequestWithOwnAttributes, FolderServeRequest, ServeRequestCollectReply, ServeRequestExecuteFileOnReply, ServeRequestReplyToFile, ServeRequestReplyToFolder, ServeRequestReplyToTempFile, ServeRequestReplyToTempFolder, ServeRequestReplyToTestFolder, SimpleServeRequest, TempFolderServeRequest, TestFolderServeRequest, WrapServeRequest

    public interface BodyAccessUnknown
    The idea is that there is a simple way to work with this kind of values. The least you must do is check is it empty, binary or text and, if not, convert it to binary or text as you prefer. To make things more optimal you can check additional isXXX methods when you are ready or prefer to handle this. But in any case an object can be easily converted to either binary or text. There is an alternative way for some special cases: you use getObject() method and work with java object provided. Technically, getObject method will return NULL only when isEmpty() returns true, except some special cases: empty binary or empty character sequence.
    Author:
    myx

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default Object getObject() 
      default Class<?> getObjectClass() 
      default boolean isBinary()
      returns true when object is a meaningful instance of BodyAccessBinary interface and getBinary() method would return guaranteed non-null and seems to be non-empty instance of Transfer.Buffer class.
      default boolean isCharacter()
      returns true when object is a meaningful instance of BodyAccessCharacter interface and getText() method would return guaranteed non-null and seems to be non-empty instance of java.lang.String class.
      default boolean isEmpty()
      returns true when any of getBinary(), getFile(), getText() or getObject() will return null value.
      default boolean isObject()
      returns true when getObject() method would return guaranteed non-null.
      BodyAccessBinary toBinary()
      Returns an instance whose isEmpty(), isBinary() or isFile() method will return true and getBinary() or getFile() will return a binary non-null representation of a response.
      BodyAccessCharacter toCharacter()
      Returns an instance isEmpty(), isCharacter() and isObject() method will return true and getText() or getObject() will return a non-null stringual representation of object's body.

        Returns:

      • isBinary

        default boolean isBinary()
        returns true when object is a meaningful instance of BodyAccessBinary interface and getBinary() method would return guaranteed non-null and seems to be non-empty instance of Transfer.Buffer class.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • isCharacter

        default boolean isCharacter()
        returns true when object is a meaningful instance of BodyAccessCharacter interface and getText() method would return guaranteed non-null and seems to be non-empty instance of java.lang.String class.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • isEmpty

        default boolean isEmpty()
        returns true when any of getBinary(), getFile(), getText() or getObject() will return null value.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • isObject

        default boolean isObject()
        returns true when getObject() method would return guaranteed non-null. This still can be a File, a String or a Binary object, so check the isEmpty(), isBinary() and isCharacter() methods first.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • toBinary

        BodyAccessBinary toBinary()
                   throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Returns an instance whose isEmpty(), isBinary() or isFile() method will return true and getBinary() or getFile() will return a binary non-null representation of a response. When a response is already meets conditions specified this method should return exactly the SAME response object. The "Character-Encoding" of "Content-Type" attributes of a current response and "Accept-Charset" or "Accept-Type" attributes of current query should be considered when possible. "UTF-8" encoding should be used by default.
        Returns:
        message
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException

      • toCharacter

        BodyAccessCharacter toCharacter()
                         throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Returns an instance isEmpty(), isCharacter() and isObject() method will return true and getText() or getObject() will return a non-null stringual representation of object's body. When an object is already meet these conditions, this method should return exactly the SAME object. The "Character-Encoding" attribute of a current response and "Accept-Charset" attribute of current query should be considered when possible. "UTF-8" encoding should be used by default.
        Returns:
        message
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
